name: chebakia
ingredients: 125 g of golden and ground sesame seeds
1 tea glass of ½ melted butter and ½ neutral oil (for the dough)
2 tea glasses of orange blossom water
1 teaspoon of dry roasted and ground anise
¼ teaspoon of pure high-quality saffron
1 bowl of golden sesame seeds (for decoration)
steps: In a large dish, mix the flour, almond powder, salt, ground sesame, anise, cinnamon, and yeasts.
Add the melted butter/oil mixture, the egg yolk, saffron, and orange blossom water. Knead to obtain a homogeneous and malleable dough. Divide the dough into balls.
Roll out each ball thinly with a rolling pin or pasta machine. Cut rectangles and use a pastry wheel to create 5 strips inside each rectangle, leaving the edges intact.
Shape the chebakia into a flower or rose shape by braiding the strips and pinching opposite corners to seal them.
Fry the chebakias in hot (but not smoking) oil until golden.
Drain and immediately dip them in warm honey. Let them drain.
Decorate with golden sesame seeds. Serve cold.
